oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Promise Land: historic marker and school
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Promise Land Rd., N of Reddon Crossing/Will G Rd, Promise, Dickson Co., TN

Color photograph of a historic marker and a school in the background; historic marker entitled "Promise Land" and describes the establishment of the Promise Land African American community; one-story white L-shaped school in the background with gable roof, having seven visible rectangular windows and a main entrance on the left.

Freed slaves established Promise Land shortly after the Civil War. It was the first African American community of Dickson County. In time, is encompassed about 1000 acres, including 50 homes, several stores, two churches, and a school. Only the St. John Church and the schoolhouse remain.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American schools -- Tennessee
Churches; Historic sites; Historical markers; Schools
